title: Horton Country Park
text:
Horton Country Park is a <a href="Local%20Nature%20Reserve">Local Nature Reserve</a> north-west of <a href="Epsom">Epsom</a> in <a href="Surrey">Surrey</a>. It is owned and managed by <a href="Epsom%20and%20Ewell%20Borough%20Council">Epsom and Ewell Borough Council</a>.
The park is a wooded recreation and amenities area occupying the east of a narrow upland <a href="drainage%20divide">watershed</a> between two tributaries. As such, the summit being the parish divide, it is in traditional terms, within Epsom <a href="parish">parish</a> and occupies land due west of the town, and due east of the semi-rural, semi-urban London district of <a href="Chessington">Chessington</a>.
Part of the area is occupied by Hobbledown Children's Farm, which contains various folkloric themed adventure playgrounds and a small zoo hosting domestic farm animals, and exotics such as <a href="meerkat">meerkat</a>, <a href="nilgai">nilgai</a>, <a href="emu">emu</a> and <a href="Bactrian%20camel">Bactrian camel</a>. The farm is not open to adults without children. The <a href="Horton%20Light%20Railway">Horton Light Railway</a> used to run through this land from <a href="Ewell%20West%20railway%20station">Ewell West railway station</a> to the five <a href="psychiatric%20hospital">psychiatric hospital</a>s owned by the <a href="London%20County%20Council">London County Council</a>, known as the <a href="Epsom%20Cluster">Epsom Cluster</a>. Parts of the landscaped grounds of these hospitals have now been incorporated into the country park.
The <a href="Thames%20Down%20Link">Thames Down Link</a> long-distance footpath from <a href="Kingston%20upon%20Thames">Kingston upon Thames</a> to <a href="Box%20Hill%20%26amp%3B%20Westhumble%20railway%20station">Box Hill & Westhumble station</a> passes through the park.
